alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for medical suspension payments
body:
$!As an employer, you might suspend an employee on health grounds but continue to pay them.$!

##What to report and pay

Medical suspension payments count as earnings, so:

- add them to your employee's other earnings
- deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance using your usual payroll procedures

##Technical guidance

The following guides contain more detailed information:

- [employment protection legislation](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim02550.htm "Employment protection legislation")
- [Class 1 NICs - medical suspension payments](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/nimmanual/nim07011.htm "Class 1 NICs - medical suspension payments")

*[PAYE]:Pay As You Earn
